  16. /* Classification of addresses for GC and runtime purposes. */

  18. /* Multicore runtime supports only the "no naked pointers" mode where any
  19.    out-of-heap pointers are not observable by the GC. The out-of-heap pointers
  20.    are either:

  22.    - wrapped in Abstract_tag or Custom_tag objects, or
  23.    - have a valid header with colour `NOT_MARKABLE`, or
  24.    - made to look like immediate values by tagging the least significant bit so
  25.      that the GC does not follow it. This strategy has the downside that
  26.      out-of-heap pointers may not point to odd addresses.

  28.    A valid value is either:
  29.    - a tagged integer (Is_long)
  30.    - a pointer to the minor heap
  31.    - a pointer to a well-formed block outside the minor heap. It may be in the
  32.      major heap, or static data allocated by the OCaml code or the OCaml
  33.      runtime, or a foreign pointer.

  35.    To create a well-formed block outside the heap that the GC will not scan,
  36.    one can use the Caml_out_of_heap_header from mlvalues.h.
  37. */

  39. #ifndef CAML_ADDRESS_CLASS_H
  40. ‌#define CAML_ADDRESS_CLASS_H

  42. #include "config.h"
  43. #include "misc.h"
  44. #include "mlvalues.h"

  46. ‌CAMLextern uintnat caml_minor_heaps_start;
  47. ‌CAMLextern uintnat caml_minor_heaps_end;

  49. /* Is_young(val) is true iff val is in the reserved area for minor heaps */

  51. ‌#define Is_young(val) \
  52.   (CAMLassert (Is_block (val)), \
  53.    (char *)(val) < (char *)caml_minor_heaps_end && \
  54.    (char *)(val) > (char *)caml_minor_heaps_start)

  56. ‌#define Is_block_and_young(val) (Is_block(val) && Is_young(val))

  58. /* These definitions are retained for backwards compatibility with OCaml 4 */
  59. ‌#define Is_in_heap_or_young(a) 1
  60. ‌#define Is_in_value_area(a) 1

  62. #endif /* CAML_ADDRESS_CLASS_H */
